072/**
073 * Represents a request to a remote REST resource.
074 *
075 * <p>
076 * Instances of this class are created by the various creator methods on the {@link RestClient} class.
077 *
078 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
079 * <p class='bjava'>
080 *    <jc>// Create a request and automatically close it.</jc>
081 *    <jk>try</jk> (<jv>RestRequest</jv> <jv>req</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<js>"/myResource"</js>)) {
082 *       <jv>req</jv>
083 *          .queryData(<js>"foo"</js>, <js>"bar"</js>)
084 *          .run()
085 *          .assertStatus().asCode().is(200);
086 *    }
087 * </p>
088 *
089 * <p>
090 * The {@link #close()} method will automatically close any associated {@link RestResponse} if one was created via {@link #run()}.
091 *
092 * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
093 *    <li class='warn'>This class is not thread safe.
094 *    <li class='note'>This class implements {@link AutoCloseable} and can be used in try-with-resources blocks.
095 *       The {@link #close()} method allows unchecked exceptions to propagate for debuggability,
096 *       while catching and logging checked exceptions to follow AutoCloseable best practices.
097 * </ul>
098 *
099 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
100 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/JuneauRestClientBasics">juneau-rest-client Basics</a>
101 * </ul>
102 */
103public class RestRequest extends BeanSession implements HttpUriRequest, Configurable, AutoCloseable {
104
105   private static final ContentType TEXT_PLAIN = ContentType.TEXT_PLAIN;
106
107   final RestClient client;                               // The client that created this call.
108   private final HttpRequestBase request;                 // The request.
109   private RestResponse response;                         // The response.
110   List<RestCallInterceptor> interceptors = list();   // Used for intercepting and altering requests.
111
112   private HeaderList headerData;
113   private PartList queryData, formData, pathData;
114
115   private boolean ignoreErrors, suppressLogging;
116
117   private Object content;
118   private Serializer serializer;
119   private Parser parser;
120   private HttpPartSchema contentSchema;
121   private URIBuilder uriBuilder;
122   private Predicate<Integer> errorCodes;
123   private HttpHost target;
124   private HttpContext context;
125   private List<Class<? extends Throwable>> rethrow;
126   private HttpPartSerializerSession partSerializerSession;
127
128   private final Map<HttpPartSerializer,HttpPartSerializerSession> partSerializerSessions = new IdentityHashMap<>();
129
130   /**
131    * Constructs a REST call with the specified method name.
132    *
133    * @param client The client that created this request.
134    * @param uri The target URI.
135    * @param method The HTTP method name (uppercase).
136    * @param hasBody Whether this method has a body.
137    * @throws RestCallException If an exception or non-200 response code occurred during the connection attempt.
138    */
139   protected RestRequest(RestClient client, URI uri, String method, boolean hasBody) throws RestCallException {
140      super(client.getBeanContext().createSession());
141      this.client = client;
142      this.request = createInnerRequest(method, uri, hasBody);
143      this.errorCodes = client.errorCodes;
144      this.uriBuilder = new URIBuilder(request.getURI());
145      this.ignoreErrors = client.ignoreErrors;
146      this.headerData = client.createHeaderData();
147      this.queryData = client.createQueryData();
148      this.formData = client.createFormData();
149      this.pathData = client.createPathData();
150   }
151
152   /**
153    * Constructs the {@link HttpRequestBase} object that ends up being passed to the client execute method.
154    *
155    * <p>
156    * Subclasses can override this method to create their own request base objects.
157    *
158    * @param method The HTTP method.
159    * @param uri The HTTP URI.
160    * @param hasBody Whether the HTTP request has a body.
161    * @return A new {@link HttpRequestBase} object.
162    */
163   protected HttpRequestBase createInnerRequest(String method, URI uri, boolean hasBody) {
164      HttpRequestBase req = hasBody ? new BasicHttpEntityRequestBase(this, method) : new BasicHttpRequestBase(this, method);
165      req.setURI(uri);
166      return req;
167   }
168
169   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
170   // Configuration
171   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
172
173   /**
174    * Convenience method for specifying JSON as the marshalling transmission media type for this request only.
175    *
176    * <p>
177    * {@link JsonSerializer} will be used to serialize POJOs to request bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#serializer(Serializer)}.
178    *    <ul>
179    *       <li>The serializer can be configured using any of the serializer property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#sortCollections()}) or
180    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
181    *    </ul>
182    * <p>
183    *    {@link JsonParser} will be used to parse POJOs from response bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#parser(Parser)}.
184    *    <ul>
185    *       <li>The parser can be configured using any of the parser property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#strict()}) or
186    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
187    *    </ul>
188    * <p>
189    *    <c>Accept</c> request header will be set to <js>"application/json"</js> unless overridden
190    *       by {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#accept(String)}.
191    * <p>
192    *    <c>Content-Type</c> request header will be set to <js>"application/json"</js> unless overridden
193    *       {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#contentType(String)}.
194    * <p>
195    *    Identical to calling <c>serializer(JsonSerializer.<jk>class</jk>).parser(JsonParser.<jk>class</jk>)</c>.
196    *
197    * @return This object.
198    */
199   public RestRequest json() {
200      return serializer(JsonSerializer.class).parser(JsonParser.class);
201   }
202
203   /**
204    * Convenience method for specifying Simplified JSON as the marshalling transmission media type for this request only.
205    *
206    * <p>
207    * Simplified JSON is typically useful for automated tests because you can do simple string comparison of results
208    * without having to escape lots of quotes.
209    *
210    * <p>
211    *    {@link Json5Serializer} will be used to serialize POJOs to request bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#serializer(Serializer)}.
212    *    <ul>
213    *       <li>The serializer can be configured using any of the serializer property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#sortCollections()}) or
214    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
215    *    </ul>
216    * <p>
217    *    {@link Json5Parser} will be used to parse POJOs from response bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#parser(Parser)}.
218    *    <ul>
219    *       <li>The parser can be configured using any of the parser property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#strict()}) or
220    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
221    *    </ul>
222    * <p>
223    *    <c>Accept</c> request header will be set to <js>"application/json"</js> unless overridden
224    *       by {@link #header(String,Object)} or {@link #accept(String)}, or per-request via {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#accept(String)}.
225    * <p>
226    *    <c>Content-Type</c> request header will be set to <js>"application/json+simple"</js> unless overridden
227    *       by {@link #header(String,Object)} or {@link #contentType(String)}, or per-request via {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#contentType(String)}.
228    * <p>
229    *    Can be combined with other marshaller setters such as {@link #xml()} to provide support for multiple languages.
230    *    <ul>
231    *       <li>When multiple languages are supported, the <c>Accept</c> and <c>Content-Type</c> headers control which marshallers are used, or uses the
232    *       last-enabled language if the headers are not set.
233    *    </ul>
234    * <p>
235    *    Identical to calling <c>serializer(Json5Serializer.<jk>class</jk>).parser(Json5Parser.<jk>class</jk>)</c>.
236    *
237    * @return This object.
238    */
239   public RestRequest json5() {
240      return serializer(Json5Serializer.class).parser(Json5Parser.class);
241   }
242
243   /**
244    * Convenience method for specifying XML as the marshalling transmission media type for this request only.
245    *
246    * <p>
247    * {@link XmlSerializer} will be used to serialize POJOs to request bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#serializer(Serializer)}.
248    *    <ul>
249    *       <li>The serializer can be configured using any of the serializer property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#sortCollections()}) or
250    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
251    *    </ul>
252    * <p>
253    *    {@link XmlParser} will be used to parse POJOs from response bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#parser(Parser)}.
254    *    <ul>
255    *       <li>The parser can be configured using any of the parser property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#strict()}) or
256    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
257    *    </ul>
258    * <p>
259    *    <c>Accept</c> request header will be set to <js>"text/xml"</js> unless overridden
260    *       by {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#accept(String)}.
261    * <p>
262    *    <c>Content-Type</c> request header will be set to <js>"text/xml"</js> unless overridden
263    *       by {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#contentType(String)}.
264    * <p>
265    *    Identical to calling <c>serializer(XmlSerializer.<jk>class</jk>).parser(XmlParser.<jk>class</jk>)</c>.
266    *
267    * @return This object.
268    */
269   public RestRequest xml() {
270      return serializer(XmlSerializer.class).parser(XmlParser.class);
271   }

273   /**
274    * Convenience method for specifying HTML as the marshalling transmission media type for this request only.
275    *
276    * <p>
277    * POJOs are converted to HTML without any sort of doc wrappers.
278    *
279    * <p>
280    *    {@link HtmlSerializer} will be used to serialize POJOs to request bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#serializer(Serializer)}.
281    *    <ul>
282    *       <li>The serializer can be configured using any of the serializer property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#sortCollections()}) or
283    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
284    *    </ul>
285    * <p>
286    *    {@link HtmlParser} will be used to parse POJOs from response bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#parser(Parser)}.
287    *    <ul>
288    *       <li>The parser can be configured using any of the parser property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#strict()}) or
289    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
290    *    </ul>
291    * <p>
292    *    <c>Accept</c> request header will be set to <js>"text/html"</js> unless overridden
293    *       by {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#accept(String)}.
294    * <p>
295    *    <c>Content-Type</c> request header will be set to <js>"text/html"</js> unless overridden
296    *       by {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#contentType(String)}.
297    * <p>
298    *    Identical to calling <c>serializer(HtmlSerializer.<jk>class</jk>).parser(HtmlParser.<jk>class</jk>)</c>.
299    *
300    * @return This object.
301    */
302   public RestRequest html() {
303      return serializer(HtmlSerializer.class).parser(HtmlParser.class);
304   }

320    *    <ul>

339   /**
340    * Convenience method for specifying Stripped HTML DOC as the marshalling transmission media type for this request only.
341    *
342    * <p>
343    * Same as {@link #htmlDoc()} but without the header and body tags and page title and description.
344    *
345    * <p>
346    *    {@link HtmlStrippedDocSerializer} will be used to serialize POJOs to request bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#serializer(Serializer)}.
347    *    <ul>
348    *       <li>The serializer can be configured using any of the serializer property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#sortCollections()}) or
349    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
350    *    </ul>
351    * <p>
352    *    {@link HtmlParser} will be used to parse POJOs from response bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#parser(Parser)}.
353    *    <ul>
354    *       <li>The parser can be configured using any of the parser property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#strict()}) or
355    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
356    *    </ul>
357    * <p>
358    *    <c>Accept</c> request header will be set to <js>"text/html+stripped"</js> unless overridden
359    *       by {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#accept(String)}.
360    * <p>
361    *    <c>Content-Type</c> request header will be set to <js>"text/html+stripped"</js> unless overridden
362    *       by {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#contentType(String)}.
363    * <p>
364    *    Identical to calling <c>serializer(HtmlStrippedDocSerializer.<jk>class</jk>).parser(HtmlParser.<jk>class</jk>)</c>.
365    *
366    * @return This object.
367    */
368   public RestRequest htmlStrippedDoc() {
369      return serializer(HtmlStrippedDocSerializer.class).parser(HtmlParser.class);
370   }

372   /**
373    * Convenience method for specifying Plain Text as the marshalling transmission media type for this request only.
374    *
375    * <p>
376    * Plain text marshalling typically only works on simple POJOs that can be converted to and from strings using
377    * swaps, swap methods, etc...
378    *
379    * <p>
380    *    {@link PlainTextSerializer} will be used to serialize POJOs to request bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#serializer(Serializer)}.
381    *    <ul>
382    *       <li>The serializer can be configured using any of the serializer property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#sortCollections()}) or
383    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
384    *    </ul>
385    * <p>
386    *    {@link PlainTextParser} will be used to parse POJOs from response bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#parser(Parser)}.
387    *    <ul>
388    *       <li>The parser can be configured using any of the parser property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#strict()}) or
389    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
390    *    </ul>
391    * <p>
392    *    <c>Accept</c> request header will be set to <js>"text/plain"</js> unless overridden
393    *       by {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#accept(String)}.
394    * <p>
395    *    <c>Content-Type</c> request header will be set to <js>"text/plain"</js> unless overridden
396    *       by {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#contentType(String)}.
397    * <p>
398    *    Identical to calling <c>serializer(PlainTextSerializer.<jk>class</jk>).parser(PlainTextParser.<jk>class</jk>)</c>.
399    *
400    * @return This object.
401    */
402   public RestRequest plainText() {
403      return serializer(PlainTextSerializer.class).parser(PlainTextParser.class);
404   }

406   /**
407    * Convenience method for specifying MessagePack as the marshalling transmission media type for this request only.
408    *
409    * <p>
410    * MessagePack is a binary equivalent to JSON that takes up considerably less space than JSON.
411    *
412    * <p>
413    *    {@link MsgPackSerializer} will be used to serialize POJOs to request bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#serializer(Serializer)}.
414    *    <ul>
415    *       <li>The serializer can be configured using any of the serializer property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#sortCollections()}) or
416    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
417    *    </ul>
418    * <p>
419    *    {@link MsgPackParser} will be used to parse POJOs from response bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#parser(Parser)}.
420    *    <ul>
421    *       <li>The parser can be configured using any of the parser property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#strict()}) or
422    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
423    *    </ul>
424    * <p>
425    *    <c>Accept</c> request header will be set to <js>"octal/msgpack"</js> unless overridden
426    *       by {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#accept(String)}.
427    * <p>
428    *    <c>Content-Type</c> request header will be set to <js>"octal/msgpack"</js> unless overridden
429    *       by {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#contentType(String)}.
430    * <p>
431    *    Identical to calling <c>serializer(MsgPackSerializer.<jk>class</jk>).parser(MsgPackParser.<jk>class</jk>)</c>.
432    *
433    * @return This object.
434    */
435   public RestRequest msgPack() {
436      return serializer(MsgPackSerializer.class).parser(MsgPackParser.class);
437   }

439   /**
440    * Convenience method for specifying UON as the marshalling transmission media type for this request only.
441    *
442    * <p>
443    * UON is Url-Encoding Object notation that is equivalent to JSON but suitable for transmission as URL-encoded
444    * query and form post values.
445    *
446    * <p>
447    *    {@link UonSerializer} will be used to serialize POJOs to request bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#serializer(Serializer)}.
448    *    <ul>
449    *       <li>The serializer can be configured using any of the serializer property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#sortCollections()}) or
450    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
451    *    </ul>
452    * <p>
453    *    {@link UonParser} will be used to parse POJOs from response bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#parser(Parser)}.
454    *    <ul>
455    *       <li>The parser can be configured using any of the parser property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#strict()}) or
456    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
457    *    </ul>
458    * <p>
459    *    <c>Accept</c> request header will be set to <js>"text/uon"</js> unless overridden
460    *       by {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#accept(String)}.
461    * <p>
462    *    <c>Content-Type</c> request header will be set to <js>"text/uon"</js> unless overridden
463    *       by {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#contentType(String)}.
464    * <p>
465    *    Identical to calling <c>serializer(UonSerializer.<jk>class</jk>).parser(UonParser.<jk>class</jk>)</c>.
466    *
467    * @return This object.
468    */
469   public RestRequest uon() {
470      return serializer(UonSerializer.class).parser(UonParser.class);
471   }
472
473   /**
474    * Convenience method for specifying URL-Encoding as the marshalling transmission media type for this request only.
475    *
476    * <p>
477    *    {@link UrlEncodingSerializer} will be used to serialize POJOs to request bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#serializer(Serializer)}.
478    *    <ul>
479    *       <li>The serializer can be configured using any of the serializer property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#sortCollections()}) or
480    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
481    *       <li>This serializer is NOT used when using the {@link RestRequest#formData(String, Object)} (and related) methods for constructing
482    *          the request body.  Instead, the part serializer specified via {@link RestClient.Builder#partSerializer(Class)} is used.
483    *    </ul>
484    * <p>
485    *    {@link UrlEncodingParser} will be used to parse POJOs from response bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#parser(Parser)}.
486    *    <ul>
487    *       <li>The parser can be configured using any of the parser property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#strict()}) or
488    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
489    *    </ul>
490    * <p>
491    *    <c>Accept</c> request header will be set to <js>"application/x-www-form-urlencoded"</js> unless overridden
492    *       by {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#accept(String)}.
493    * <p>
494    *    <c>Content-Type</c> request header will be set to <js>"application/x-www-form-urlencoded"</js> unless overridden
495    *       by {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#contentType(String)}.
496    * <p>
497    *    Identical to calling <c>serializer(UrlEncodingSerializer.<jk>class</jk>).parser(UrlEncodingParser.<jk>class</jk>)</c>.
498    *
499    * @return This object.
500    */
501   public RestRequest urlEnc() {
502      return serializer(UrlEncodingSerializer.class).parser(UrlEncodingParser.class);
503   }
504
505   /**
506    * Convenience method for specifying OpenAPI as the marshalling transmission media type for this request only.
507    *
508    * <p>
509    * OpenAPI is a language that allows serialization to formats that use {@link HttpPartSchema} objects to describe their structure.
510    *
511    * <p>
512    *    {@link OpenApiSerializer} will be used to serialize POJOs to request bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#serializer(Serializer)}.
513    *    <ul>
514    *       <li>The serializer can be configured using any of the serializer property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#sortCollections()}) or
515    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
516    *       <li>Typically the {@link RestRequest#content(Object, HttpPartSchema)} method will be used to specify the body of the request with the
517    *          schema describing it's structure.
518    *    </ul>
519    * <p>
520    *    {@link OpenApiParser} will be used to parse POJOs from response bodies unless overridden per request via {@link RestRequest#parser(Parser)}.
521    *    <ul>
522    *       <li>The parser can be configured using any of the parser property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#strict()}) or
523    *          bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
524    *       <li>Typically the {@link ResponseContent#schema(HttpPartSchema)} method will be used to specify the structure of the response body.
525    *    </ul>
526    * <p>
527    *    <c>Accept</c> request header will be set to <js>"text/openapi"</js> unless overridden
528    *       by {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#accept(String)}.
529    * <p>
530    *    <c>Content-Type</c> request header will be set to <js>"text/openapi"</js> unless overridden
531    *       by {@link RestRequest#header(String,Object)} or {@link RestRequest#contentType(String)}.
532    * <p>
533    *    Identical to calling <c>serializer(OpenApiSerializer.<jk>class</jk>).parser(OpenApiParser.<jk>class</jk>)</c>.
534    *
535    * @return This object.
536    */
537   public RestRequest openApi() {
538      return serializer(OpenApiSerializer.class).parser(OpenApiParser.class);
539   }
540
541   /**
542    * Specifies the serializer to use on the request body.
543    *
544    * <p>
545    * Overrides the serializers specified on the {@link RestClient}.
546    *
547    * <p>
548    *    The serializer is not modified by an of the serializer property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#sortCollections()}) or
549    *    bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
550    *
551    * <p>
552    * If the <c>Content-Type</c> header is not set on the request, it will be set to the media type of this serializer.
553    *
554    * @param serializer The serializer used to serialize POJOs to the body of the HTTP request.
555    * @return This object.
556    */
557   public RestRequest serializer(Serializer serializer) {
558      this.serializer = serializer;
559      return this;
560   }
561
562   /**
563    * Specifies the serializer to use on the request body.
564    *
565    * <p>
566    * Overrides the serializers specified on the {@link RestClient}.
567    *
568    * <p>
569    *    The serializer can be configured using any of the serializer property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#sortCollections()}) or
570    *    bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
571    *
572    * <p>
573    * If the <c>Content-Type</c> header is not set on the request, it will be set to the media type of this serializer.
574    *
575    * @param serializer The serializer used to serialize POJOs to the body of the HTTP request.
576    * @return This object.
577    */
578   public RestRequest serializer(Class<? extends Serializer> serializer) {
579      this.serializer = client.getInstance(serializer);
580      return this;
581   }

583   /**
584    * Specifies the parser to use on the response body.
585    *
586    * <p>
587    * Overrides the parsers specified on the {@link RestClient}.
588    *
589    * <p>
590    *    The parser is not modified by any of the parser property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#strict()}) or
591    *    bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
592    *
593    * <p>
594    * If the <c>Accept</c> header is not set on the request, it will be set to the media type of this parser.
595    *
596    * @param parser The parser used to parse POJOs from the body of the HTTP response.
597    * @return This object.
598    */
599   public RestRequest parser(Parser parser) {
600      this.parser = parser;
601      return this;
602   }
603
604   /**
605    * Specifies the parser to use on the response body.
606    *
607    * <p>
608    * Overrides the parsers specified on the {@link RestClient}.
609    *
610    * <p>
611    *    The parser can be configured using any of the parser property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#strict()}) or
612    *    bean context property setters (e.g. {@link RestClient.Builder#swaps(Class...)}) defined on this builder class.
613    *
614    * <p>
615    * If the <c>Accept</c> header is not set on the request, it will be set to the media type of this parser.
616    *
617    * @param parser The parser used to parse POJOs from the body of the HTTP response.
618    * @return This object.
619    */
620   public RestRequest parser(Class<? extends Parser> parser) {
621      this.parser = client.getInstance(parser);
622      return this;
623   }
624
625   /**
626    * Allows you to override what status codes are considered error codes that would result in a {@link RestCallException}.
627    *
628    * <p>
629    * The default error code predicate is: <code>x -&gt; x &gt;= 400</code>.
630    *
631    * @param value The new predicate for calculating error codes.
632    * @return This object.
633    */
634   public RestRequest errorCodes(Predicate<Integer> value) {
635      this.errorCodes = value;
636      return this;
637   }
638
639   /**
640    * Add one or more interceptors for this call only.
641    *
642    * @param interceptors The interceptors to add to this call.
643    * @return This object.
644    * @throws RestCallException If init method on interceptor threw an exception.
645    */
646   public RestRequest interceptors(RestCallInterceptor...interceptors) throws RestCallException {
647      try {
648         for (RestCallInterceptor i : interceptors) {
649            this.interceptors.add(i);
650            i.onInit(this);
651         }
652      } catch (RuntimeException | RestCallException e) {
653         throw e;
654      } catch (Exception e) {
655         throw new RestCallException(null, e, "Interceptor threw an exception on init.");
656      }
657
658      return this;
659   }
660
661   /**
662    * Prevent {@link RestCallException RestCallExceptions} from being thrown when HTTP status 400+ is encountered.
663    *
664    * <p>
665    * This overrides the <l>ignoreErrors</l> property on the client.
666    *
667    * @return This object.
668    */
669   public RestRequest ignoreErrors() {
670      this.ignoreErrors = true;
671      return this;
672   }
673
674   /**
675    * Rethrow any of the specified exception types if a matching <c>Exception-Name</c> header is found.
676    *
677    * <p>
678    * Rethrown exceptions will be set on the caused-by exception of {@link RestCallException} when
679    * thrown from the {@link #run()} method.
680    *
681    * <p>
682    * Can be called multiple times to append multiple rethrows.
683    *
684    * @param values The classes to rethrow.
685    * @return This object.
686    */
687   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
688   public RestRequest rethrow(Class<?>...values) {
689      if (rethrow == null)
690         rethrow = list();
691      for (Class<?> v : values) {
692         if (v != null && Throwable.class.isAssignableFrom(v))
693            rethrow.add((Class<? extends Throwable>)v);
694      }
695      return this;
696   }
697
698   /**
699    * Sets <c>Debug: value</c> header on this request.
700    *
701    * @return This object.
702    * @throws RestCallException Invalid input.
703    */
704   public RestRequest debug() throws RestCallException {
705      header("Debug", true);
706      return this;
707   }
708
709   /**
710    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if debug mode is currently enabled.
711    */
712   @Override
713   public boolean isDebug() {
714      return headerData.get("Debug", Boolean.class).orElse(false);
715   }
716
717   /**
718    * Causes logging to be suppressed for the duration of this request.
719    *
720    * <p>
721    * Overrides the {@link #debug()} setting on this request or client.
722    *
723    * @return This object.
724    */
725   public RestRequest suppressLogging() {
726      this.suppressLogging = true;
727      return this;
728   }
729
730   boolean isLoggingSuppressed() {
731      return suppressLogging;
732   }

735    * Specifies the target host for the request.
736    *
737    * @param target The target host for the request.
738    *    Implementations may accept <jk>null</jk> if they can still determine a route, for example to a default
739    *    target or by inspecting the request.
740    * @return This object.
741    */
742   public RestRequest target(HttpHost target) {
743      this.target = target;
744      return this;
745   }

749    *
750    * @param context The context to use for the execution, or <jk>null</jk> to use the default context.
751    * @return This object.
752    */
753   public RestRequest context(HttpContext context) {
754      this.context = context;
755      return this;
756   }

802   /**
803    * Appends a header to the request.
804    *
805    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
806    * <p class='bjava'>
807    *    <jc>// Adds header "Foo: bar".</jc>
808    *    <jv>client</jv>
809    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
810    *       .header(Accept.<jsf>TEXT_XML</jsf>)
811    *       .run();
812    * </p>
813    *
814    * @param part
815    *    The parameter to set.
816    *    <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
817    * @return This object.
818    */
819   public RestRequest header(Header part) {
820      return headers(part);
821   }
822
823   /**
824    * Appends multiple headers to the request.
825    *
826    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
827    * <p class='bjava'>
828    *    <jc>// Appends two headers to the request.</jc>
829    *    <jv>client</jv>
830    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
831    *       .headers(
832    *          BasicHeader.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"Foo"</js>, <js>"bar"</js>),
833    *          Accept.<jsf>TEXT_XML</jsf>
834    *       )
835    *       .run();
836    * </p>
837    *
838    * @param parts
839    *    The parameters to set.
840    *    <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
841    * @return This object.
842    */
843   public RestRequest headers(Header...parts) {
844      headerData.append(parts);
845      return this;
846   }
847
848   /**
849    * Appends multiple query parameters to the request.
850    *
851    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
852    * <p class='bjava'>
853    *    <jc>// Appends two query parameters to the request.</jc>
854    *    <jv>client</jv>
855    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
856    *       .queryData(
857    *          BasicStringPart.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"foo"</js>, <js>"bar"</js>),
858    *          BasicBooleanPart.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"baz"</js>, <jk>true</jk>)
859    *       )
860    *       .run();
861    * </p>
862    *
863    * @param parts
864    *    The parameters to set.
865    *    <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
866    * @return This object.
867    */
868   public RestRequest queryData(NameValuePair...parts) {
869      queryData.append(parts);
870      return this;
871   }
872
873   /**
874    * Appends multiple form-data parameters to the request.
875    *
876    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
877    * <p class='bjava'>
878    *    <jc>// Appends two form-data parameters to the request.</jc>
879    *    <jv>client</jv>
880    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
881    *       .formData(
882    *          BasicStringPart.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"foo"</js>, <js>"bar"</js>),
883    *          BasicBooleanPart.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"baz"</js>, <jk>true</jk>)
884    *       )
885    *       .run();
886    * </p>
887    *
888    * @param parts
889    *    The parameters to set.
890    *    <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
891    * @return This object.
892    */
893   public RestRequest formData(NameValuePair...parts) {
894      formData.append(parts);
895      return this;
896   }
897
898   /**
899    * Sets or replaces multiple path parameters on the request.
900    *
901    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
902    * <p class='bjava'>
903    *    <jc>// Appends two path parameters to the request.</jc>
904    *    <jv>client</jv>
905    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
906    *       .pathData(
907    *          BasicStringPart.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"foo"</js>, <js>"bar"</js>),
908    *          BasicBooleanPart.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"baz"</js>, <jk>true</jk>)
909    *       )
910    *       .run();
911    * </p>
912    *
913    * @param parts
914    *    The parameters to set.
915    *    <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
916    * @return This object.
917    */
918   public RestRequest pathData(NameValuePair...parts) {
919      pathData.set(parts);
920      return this;
921   }
922
923   /**
924    * Appends a header to the request.
925    *
926    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
927    * <p class='bjava'>
928    *    <jc>// Adds header "Foo: bar".</jc>
929    *    <jv>client</jv>
930    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
931    *       .header(<js>"Foo"</js>, <js>"bar"</js>)
932    *       .run();
933    * </p>
934    *
935    * @param name
936    *    The parameter name.
937    * @param value
938    *    The parameter value.
939    *    <br>Non-string values are converted to strings using the {@link HttpPartSerializer} defined on the client.
940    * @return This object.
941    */
942   public RestRequest header(String name, Object value) {
943      headerData.append(createHeader(name, value));
944      return this;
945   }
946
947   /**
948    * Appends a query parameter to the URI of the request.
949    *
950    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
951    * <p class='bjava'>
952    *    <jc>// Adds query parameter "foo=bar".</jc>
953    *    <jv>client</jv>
954    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
955    *       .queryData(<js>"foo"</js>, <js>"bar"</js>)
956    *       .run();
957    * </p>
958    *
959    * @param name
960    *    The parameter name.
961    * @param value
962    *    The parameter value.
963    *    <br>Non-string values are converted to strings using the {@link HttpPartSerializer} defined on the client.
964    * @return This object.
965    */
966   public RestRequest queryData(String name, Object value) {
967      queryData.append(createPart(QUERY, name, value));
968      return this;
969   }
970
971   /**
972    * Adds a form-data parameter to the request body.
973    *
974    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
975    * <p class='bjava'>
976    *    <jc>// Adds form data parameter "foo=bar".</jc>
977    *    <jv>client</jv>
978    *       .formPost(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
979    *       .formData(<js>"foo"</js>, <js>"bar"</js>)
980    *       .run();
981    * </p>
982    *
983    * @param name
984    *    The parameter name.
985    * @param value
986    *    The parameter value.
987    *    <br>Non-string values are converted to strings using the {@link HttpPartSerializer} defined on the client.
988    * @return This object.
989    */
990   public RestRequest formData(String name, Object value) {
991      formData.append(createPart(FORMDATA, name, value));
992      return this;
993   }
994
995   /**
996    * Sets or replaces a path parameter of the form <js>"{name}"</js> in the URI.
997    *
998    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
999    * <p class='bjava'>
1000    *    <jc>// Sets path to "/bar".</jc>
1001    *    <jv>client</jv>
1002    *       .get(<js>"/{foo}"</js>)
1003    *       .pathData(<js>"foo"</js>, <js>"bar"</js>)
1004    *       .run();
1005    * </p>
1006    *
1007    * @param name
1008    *    The parameter name.
1009    * @param value
1010    *    The parameter value.
1011    *    <br>Non-string values are converted to strings using the {@link HttpPartSerializer} defined on the client.
1012    * @return This object.
1013    */
1014   public RestRequest pathData(String name, Object value) {
1015      pathData.set(createPart(PATH, name, value));
1016      return this;
1017   }
1018
1019   /**
1020    * Appends multiple headers to the request using freeform key/value pairs.
1021    *
1022    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1023    * <p class='bjava'>
1024    *    <jc>// Adds headers "Foo: bar" and "Baz: qux".</jc>
1025    *    <jv>client</jv>
1026    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1027    *       .headerPairs(<js>"Foo"</js>,<js>"bar"</js>,<js>"Baz"</js>,<js>"qux"</js>)
1028    *       .run();
1029    * </p>
1030    *
1031    * @param pairs The form-data key/value pairs.
1032    * @return This object.
1033    */
1034   public RestRequest headerPairs(String...pairs) {
1035      if (pairs.length % 2 != 0)
1036         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Odd number of parameters passed into headerPairs(String...)");
1037      HeaderList b = headerData;
1038      for (int i = 0; i < pairs.length; i+=2)
1039         b.append(pairs[i], pairs[i+1]);
1040      return this;
1041   }
1042
1043   /**
1044    * Adds query parameters to the URI query using free-form key/value pairs..
1045    *
1046    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1047    * <p class='bjava'>
1048    *    <jc>// Adds query parameters "foo=bar&amp;baz=qux".</jc>
1049    *    <jv>client</jv>
1050    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1051    *       .queryDataPairs(<js>"foo"</js>,<js>"bar"</js>,<js>"baz"</js>,<js>"qux"</js>)
1052    *       .run();
1053    * </p>
1054    *
1055    * @param pairs The query key/value pairs.
1056    *    <ul>
1057    *       <li>Values can be any POJO.
1058    *       <li>Values converted to a string using the configured part serializer.
1059    *    </ul>
1060    * @return This object.
1061    * @throws RestCallException Invalid input.
1062    */
1063   public RestRequest queryDataPairs(String...pairs) throws RestCallException {
1064      if (pairs.length % 2 != 0)
1065         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Odd number of parameters passed into queryDataPairs(String...)");
1066      PartList b = queryData;
1067      for (int i = 0; i < pairs.length; i+=2)
1068         b.append(pairs[i], pairs[i+1]);
1069      return this;
1070   }
1071
1072   /**
1073    * Adds form-data parameters to the request body using free-form key/value pairs.
1074    *
1075    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1076    * <p class='bjava'>
1077    *    <jc>// Creates form data "key1=val1&amp;key2=val2".</jc>
1078    *    <jv>client</jv>
1079    *       .formPost(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1080    *       .formDataPairs(<js>"key1"</js>,<js>"val1"</js>,<js>"key2"</js>,<js>"val2"</js>)
1081    *       .run();
1082    * </p>
1083    *
1084    * @param pairs The form-data key/value pairs.
1085    *    <ul>
1086    *       <li>Values can be any POJO.
1087    *       <li>Values converted to a string using the configured part serializer.
1088    *    </ul>
1089    * @return This object.
1090    * @throws RestCallException Invalid input.
1091    */
1092   public RestRequest formDataPairs(String...pairs) throws RestCallException {
1093      if (pairs.length % 2 != 0)
1094         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Odd number of parameters passed into formDataPairs(String...)");
1095      PartList b = formData;
1096      for (int i = 0; i < pairs.length; i+=2)
1097         b.append(pairs[i], pairs[i+1]);
1098      return this;
1099   }
1100
1101   /**
1102    * Replaces path parameters of the form <js>"{name}"</js> in the URI using free-form key/value pairs.
1103    *
1104    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1105    * <p class='bjava'>
1106    *    <jc>// Sets path to "/baz/qux".</jc>
1107    *    <jv>client</jv>
1108    *       .get(<js>"/{foo}/{bar}"</js>)
1109    *       .pathDataPairs(
1110    *          <js>"foo"</js>,<js>"baz"</js>,
1111    *          <js>"bar"</js>,<js>"qux"</js>
1112    *       )
1113    *       .run();
1114    * </p>
1115    *
1116    * @param pairs The path key/value pairs.
1117    *    <ul>
1118    *       <li>Values can be any POJO.
1119    *       <li>Values converted to a string using the configured part serializer.
1120    *    </ul>
1121    * @return This object.
1122    */
1123   public RestRequest pathDataPairs(String...pairs) {
1124      if (pairs.length % 2 != 0)
1125         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Odd number of parameters passed into pathDataPairs(String...)");
1126      PartList b = pathData;
1127      for (int i = 0; i < pairs.length; i+=2)
1128         b.set(pairs[i], pairs[i+1]);
1129      return this;
1130   }
1131
1132   /**
1133    * Appends multiple headers to the request from properties defined on a Java bean.
1134    *
1135    * <p>
1136    * Uses {@link PropertyNamerDUCS} for resolving the header names from property names.
1137    *
1138    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1139    * <p class='bjava'>
1140    *    <ja>@Bean</ja>
1141    *    <jk>public class</jk> MyHeaders {
1142    *       <jk>public</jk> String getFooBar() { <jk>return</jk> <js>"baz"</js>; }
1143    *       <jk>public</jk> Integer getQux() { <jk>return</jk> 123; }
1144    *    }
1145    *
1146    *    <jc>// Appends headers "Foo-Bar: baz" and "Qux: 123".</jc>
1147    *    <jv>client</jv>
1148    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1149    *       .headersBean(<jk>new</jk> MyHeaders())
1150    *       .run();
1151    * </p>
1152    *
1153    * @param value The bean containing the properties to set as header values.
1154    * @return This object.
1155    */
1156   public RestRequest headersBean(Object value) {
1157      if (! isBean(value))
1158         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Object passed into headersBean(Object) is not a bean.");
1159      HeaderList b = headerData;
1160      toBeanMap(value, PropertyNamerDUCS.INSTANCE).forEach((k,v) -> b.append(createHeader(k, v)));
1161      return this;
1162   }
1163
1164   /**
1165    * Appends multiple query parameters to the request from properties defined on a Java bean.
1166    *
1167    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1168    * <p class='bjava'>
1169    *    <jk>public class</jk> MyQuery {
1170    *       <jk>public</jk> String getFooBar() { <jk>return</jk> <js>"baz"</js>; }
1171    *       <jk>public</jk> Integer getQux() { <jk>return</jk> 123; }
1172    *    }
1173    *
1174    *    <jc>// Appends query "fooBar=baz&amp;qux=123".</jc>
1175    *    <jv>client</jv>
1176    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1177    *       .queryDataBean(<jk>new</jk> MyQuery())
1178    *       .run();
1179    * </p>
1180    *
1181    * @param value The bean containing the properties to set as query parameter values.
1182    * @return This object.
1183    */
1184   public RestRequest queryDataBean(Object value) {
1185      if (! isBean(value))
1186         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Object passed into queryDataBean(Object) is not a bean.");
1187      PartList b = queryData;
1188      toBeanMap(value).forEach((k,v) -> b.append(createPart(QUERY, k, v)));
1189      return this;
1190   }
1191
1192   /**
1193    * Appends multiple form-data parameters to the request from properties defined on a Java bean.
1194    *
1195    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1196    * <p class='bjava'>
1197    *    <jk>public class</jk> MyFormData {
1198    *       <jk>public</jk> String getFooBar() { <jk>return</jk> <js>"baz"</js>; }
1199    *       <jk>public</jk> Integer getQux() { <jk>return</jk> 123; }
1200    *    }
1201    *
1202    *    <jc>// Appends form data "fooBar=baz&amp;qux=123".</jc>
1203    *    <jv>client</jv>
1204    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1205    *       .formDataBean(<jk>new</jk> MyFormData())
1206    *       .run();
1207    * </p>
1208    *
1209    * @param value The bean containing the properties to set as form-data parameter values.
1210    * @return This object.
1211    */
1212   public RestRequest formDataBean(Object value) {
1213      if (! isBean(value))
1214         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Object passed into formDataBean(Object) is not a bean.");
1215      PartList b = formData;
1216      toBeanMap(value).forEach((k,v) -> b.append(createPart(FORMDATA, k, v)));
1217      return this;
1218   }

1220   /**
1221    * Sets multiple path parameters to the request from properties defined on a Java bean.
1222    *
1223    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1224    * <p class='bjava'>
1225    *    <jk>public class</jk> MyPathVars {
1226    *       <jk>public</jk> String getFooBar() { <jk>return</jk> <js>"baz"</js>; }
1227    *       <jk>public</jk> Integer getQux() { <jk>return</jk> 123; }
1228    *    }
1229    *
1230    *    <jc>// Given path "/{fooBar}/{qux}/", gets converted to "/baz/123/".</jc>
1231    *    <jv>client</jv>
1232    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1233    *       .pathDataBean(<jk>new</jk> MyPathVars())
1234    *       .run();
1235    * </p>
1236    *
1237    * @param value The bean containing the properties to set as path parameter values.
1238    * @return This object.
1239    */
1240   public RestRequest pathDataBean(Object value) {
1241      if (! isBean(value))
1242         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Object passed into pathDataBean(Object) is not a bean.");
1243      PartList b = pathData;
1244      toBeanMap(value).forEach((k,v) -> b.set(createPart(PATH, k, v)));
1245      return this;
1246   }
1247
1248   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1249   // URI
1250   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1251
1252   /**
1253    * Sets the URI for this request.
1254    *
1255    * <p>
1256    * Can be any of the following types:
1257    * <ul>
1258    *    <li>{@link URI}
1259    *    <li>{@link URL}
1260    *    <li>{@link URIBuilder}
1261    *    <li>Anything else converted to a string using {@link Object#toString()}.
1262    * </ul>
1263    *
1264    * <p>
1265    * Relative URI strings will be interpreted as relative to the root URI defined on the client.
1266    *
1267    * @param uri
1268    *    The URI of the remote REST resource.
1269    *    <br>This overrides the URI passed in from the client.
1270    *    <br>Can be any of the following types:
1271    *    <ul>
1272    *       <li>{@link URIBuilder}
1273    *       <li>{@link URI}
1274    *       <li>{@link URL}
1275    *       <li>{@link String}
1276    *       <li>{@link Object} - Converted to <c>String</c> using <c>toString()</c>
1277    *    </ul>
1278    * @return This object.
1279    * @throws RestCallException Invalid URI syntax detected.
1280    */
1281   public RestRequest uri(Object uri) throws RestCallException {
1282      URI x = client.toURI(uri, null);
1283      if (x.getScheme() != null)
1284         uriBuilder.setScheme(x.getScheme());
1285      if (x.getHost() != null)
1286         uriBuilder.setHost(x.getHost());
1287      if (x.getPort() != -1)
1288         uriBuilder.setPort(x.getPort());
1289      if (x.getUserInfo() != null)
1290         uriBuilder.setUserInfo(x.getUserInfo());
1291      if (x.getFragment() != null)
1292         uriBuilder.setFragment(x.getFragment());
1293      if (x.getQuery() != null)
1294         uriBuilder.setCustomQuery(x.getQuery());
1295      uriBuilder.setPath(x.getPath());
1296      return this;
1297   }
1298
1299   /**
1300    * Sets the URI scheme.
1301    *
1302    * @param scheme The new URI host.
1303    * @return This object.
1304    */
1305   public RestRequest uriScheme(String scheme) {
1306      uriBuilder.setScheme(scheme);
1307      return this;
1308   }
1309

1311    * Sets the URI host.

1314    * @return This object.
1315    */
1316   public RestRequest uriHost(String host) {
1317      uriBuilder.setHost(host);
1318      return this;
1319   }

1323    *

1325    * @return This object.
1326    */
1327   public RestRequest uriPort(int port) {
1328      uriBuilder.setPort(port);
1329      return this;
1330   }

1336    * @return This object.

1339      uriBuilder.setUserInfo(userInfo);
1340      return this;
1341   }

1352      return this;
