1355   /**
1356    * Sets the URI fragment.
1357    *
1358    * @param fragment The URI fragment.  The value is expected to be unescaped and may contain non ASCII characters.
1359    * @return This object.
1360    */
1361   public RestRequest uriFragment(String fragment) {
1362      uriBuilder.setFragment(fragment);
1363      return this;
1364   }
1365
1366   /**
1367    * Adds a free-form custom query.
1368    *
1369    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1370    * <p class='bjava'>
1371    *    <jc>// Adds query parameter "foo=bar&amp;baz=qux".</jc>
1372    *    <jv>client</jv>
1373    *       .get(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1374    *       .queryCustom(<js>"foo=bar&amp;baz=qux"</js>)
1375    *       .run();
1376    * </p>
1377    *
1378    * @param value The parameter value.
1379    *    <br>Can be any of the following types:
1380    *    <ul>
1381    *       <li>
1382    *          {@link CharSequence}
1383    *       <li>
1384    *          {@link Reader} - Raw contents of {@code Reader} will be serialized to remote resource.
1385    *       <li>
1386    *          {@link InputStream} - Raw contents of {@code InputStream} will be serialized to remote resource.
1387    *       <li>
1388    *          {@link PartList} - Converted to a URL-encoded query.
1389    *    </ul>
1390    * @return This object.
1391    */
1392   public RestRequest queryCustom(Object value) {
1393      try {
1394         String q = null;
1395         if (value instanceof Reader)
1396            q = read((Reader)value);
1397         else if (value instanceof InputStream)
1398            q = read((InputStream)value);
1399         else
1400            q = Utils.s(value);  // Works for NameValuePairs.
1401         uriBuilder.setCustomQuery(q);
1402      } catch (IOException e) {
1403         throw new BasicRuntimeException(e, "Could not read custom query.");
1404      }
1405      return this;
1406   }
1407
1408   /**
1409    * Adds form-data parameters as the entire body of the request.
1410    *
1411    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1412    * <p class='bjava'>
1413    *    <jc>// Creates form data "foo=bar&amp;baz=qux".</jc>
1414    *    <jv>client</jv>
1415    *       .formPost(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1416    *       .formDataCustom(<js>"foo=bar&amp;baz=qux"</js>)
1417    *       .run();
1418    *
1419    *    <jc>// Creates form data "foo=bar&amp;baz=qux" using StringEntity.</jc>
1420    *    <jv>client</jv>
1421    *       .formPost(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1422    *       .formDataCustom(<jk>new</jk> StringEntity(<js>"foo=bar&amp;baz=qux"</js>,<js>"application/x-www-form-urlencoded"</js>))
1423    *       .run();
1424    *
1425    *    <jc>// Creates form data "foo=bar&amp;baz=qux" using StringEntity and body().</jc>
1426    *    <jv>client</jv>
1427    *       .formPost(<jsf>URI</jsf>)
1428    *       .content(<jk>new</jk> StringEntity(<js>"foo=bar&amp;baz=qux"</js>,<js>"application/x-www-form-urlencoded"</js>))
1429    *       .run();
1430    * </p>
1431    *
1432    * @param value The parameter value.
1433    *    <br>Can be any of the following types:
1434    *    <ul class='spaced-list'>
1435    *       <li>
1436    *          {@link CharSequence}
1437    *       <li>
1438    *          {@link Reader} - Raw contents of {@code Reader} will be serialized to remote resource.
1439    *       <li>
1440    *          {@link InputStream} - Raw contents of {@code InputStream} will be serialized to remote resource.
1441    *       <li>
1442    *          {@link HttpResource} - Raw contents will be serialized to remote resource.  Additional headers and media type will be set on request.
1443    *       <li>
1444    *          {@link HttpEntity}/{@link BasicHttpEntity} - Bypass Juneau serialization and pass HttpEntity directly to HttpClient.
1445    *       <li>
1446    *          {@link Object} - POJO to be converted to text using the {@link Serializer} registered with the
1447    *          {@link RestClient}.
1448    *       <li>
1449    *          {@link PartList} - Converted to a URL-encoded FORM post.
1450    *    </ul>
1451    * @return This object.
1452    */
1453   public RestRequest formDataCustom(Object value) {
1454      header(ContentType.APPLICATION_FORM_URLENCODED);
1455      content(value instanceof CharSequence ? new StringReader(value.toString()) : value);
1456      return this;
1457   }
1458
1459   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1460   // Args
1461   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1462
1463   RestRequest headerArg(String name, Object value, HttpPartSchema schema, HttpPartSerializer serializer, boolean skipIfEmpty) {
1464      boolean isMulti = isEmpty(name) || "*".equals(name) || value instanceof HeaderList || isHeaderArray(value);
1465
1466      if (! isMulti) {
1467         if (! (skipIfEmpty && isEmpty(Utils.s(value))))
1468            return header(createHeader(name, value, serializer, schema, skipIfEmpty));
1469         return this;
1470      }
1471
1472      List<Header> l = list();
1473
1474      if (HttpHeaders.canCast(value)) {
1475         l.add(HttpHeaders.cast(value));
1476      } else if (value instanceof HeaderList) {
1477         ((HeaderList)value).forEach(x->l.add(x));
1478      } else if (value instanceof Collection) {
1479         ((Collection<?>)value).forEach(x -> l.add(HttpHeaders.cast(x)));
1480      } else if (isArray(value)) {
1481         for (int i = 0; i < Array.getLength(value); i++)
1482            l.add(HttpHeaders.cast(Array.get(value, i)));
1483      } else if (value instanceof Map) {
1484         toMap(value).forEach((k,v) -> l.add(createHeader(Utils.s(k), v, serializer, schema, skipIfEmpty)));
1485      } else if (isBean(value)) {
1486         toBeanMap(value).forEach((k,v) -> l.add(createHeader(k, v, serializer, schema, skipIfEmpty)));
1487      } else if (value != null) {
1488         throw new BasicRuntimeException("Invalid value type for header arg ''{0}'': {1}", name, className(value));
1489      }
1490
1491      if (skipIfEmpty)
1492         l.removeIf(x -> isEmpty(x.getValue()));
1493
1494      headerData.append(l);
1495
1496      return this;
1497   }
1498
1499   RestRequest queryArg(String name, Object value, HttpPartSchema schema, HttpPartSerializer serializer, boolean skipIfEmpty) {
1500      boolean isMulti = isEmpty(name) || "*".equals(name) || value instanceof PartList || isNameValuePairArray(value);
1501
1502      if (! isMulti) {
1503         if (! (skipIfEmpty && isEmpty(Utils.s(value))))
1504            return queryData(createPart(name, value, QUERY, serializer, schema, skipIfEmpty));
1505         return this;
1506      }
1507
1508      List<NameValuePair> l = list();
1509
1510      if (HttpParts.canCast(value)) {
1511         l.add(HttpParts.cast(value));
1512      } else if (value instanceof PartList) {
1513         ((PartList)value).forEach(x->l.add(x));
1514      } else if (value instanceof Collection) {
1515         ((Collection<?>)value).forEach(x -> l.add(HttpParts.cast(x)));
1516      } else if (isArray(value)) {
1517         for (int i = 0; i < Array.getLength(value); i++)
1518            l.add(HttpParts.cast(Array.get(value, i)));
1519      } else if (value instanceof Map) {
1520         toMap(value).forEach((k,v) -> l.add(createPart(Utils.s(k), v, QUERY, serializer, schema, skipIfEmpty)));
1521      } else if (isBean(value)) {
1522         toBeanMap(value).forEach((k,v) -> l.add(createPart(k, v, QUERY, serializer, schema, skipIfEmpty)));
1523      } else if (value != null) {
1524         queryCustom(value);
1525         return this;
1526      }
1527
1528      if (skipIfEmpty)
1529         l.removeIf(x -> isEmpty(x.getValue()));
1530
1531      queryData.append(l);
1532
1533      return this;
1534   }
1535
1536   RestRequest formDataArg(String name, Object value, HttpPartSchema schema, HttpPartSerializer serializer, boolean skipIfEmpty) {
1537      boolean isMulti = isEmpty(name) || "*".equals(name) || value instanceof PartList || isNameValuePairArray(value);
1538
1539      if (! isMulti) {
1540         if (! (skipIfEmpty && isEmpty(Utils.s(value))))
1541            return formData(createPart(name, value, FORMDATA, serializer, schema, skipIfEmpty));
1542         return this;
1543      }
1544
1545      List<NameValuePair> l = list();
1546
1547      if (HttpParts.canCast(value)) {
1548         l.add(HttpParts.cast(value));
1549      } else if (value instanceof PartList) {
1550         ((PartList)value).forEach(x->l.add(x));
1551      } else if (value instanceof Collection) {
1552         ((Collection<?>)value).forEach(x -> l.add(HttpParts.cast(x)));
1553      } else if (isArray(value)) {
1554         for (int i = 0; i < Array.getLength(value); i++)
1555            l.add(HttpParts.cast(Array.get(value, i)));
1556      } else if (value instanceof Map) {
1557         toMap(value).forEach((k,v) -> l.add(createPart(Utils.s(k), v, FORMDATA, serializer, schema, skipIfEmpty)));
1558      } else if (isBean(value)) {
1559         toBeanMap(value).forEach((k,v) -> l.add(createPart(k, v, FORMDATA, serializer, schema, skipIfEmpty)));
1560      } else if (value != null) {
1561         formDataCustom(value);
1562         return this;
1563      }
1564
1565      if (skipIfEmpty)
1566         l.removeIf(x -> isEmpty(x.getValue()));
1567
1568      formData.append(l);
1569
1570      return this;
1571   }
1572
1573   RestRequest pathArg(String name, Object value, HttpPartSchema schema, HttpPartSerializer serializer) {
1574      boolean isMulti = isEmpty(name) || "*".equals(name) || value instanceof PartList || isNameValuePairArray(value);
1575
1576      if (! isMulti)
1577         return pathData(createPart(name, value, PATH, serializer, schema, false));
1578
1579      List<NameValuePair> l = list();
1580
1581      if (HttpParts.canCast(value)) {
1582         l.add(HttpParts.cast(value));
1583      } else if (value instanceof PartList) {
1584         ((PartList)value).forEach(x->l.add(x));
1585      } else if (value instanceof Collection) {
1586         ((Collection<?>)value).forEach(x -> l.add(HttpParts.cast(x)));
1587      } else if (isArray(value)) {
1588         for (int i = 0; i < Array.getLength(value); i++)
1589            l.add(HttpParts.cast(Array.get(value, i)));
1590      } else if (value instanceof Map) {
1591         toMap(value).forEach((k,v) -> l.add(createPart(Utils.s(k), v, PATH, serializer, schema, false)));
1592      } else if (isBean(value)) {
1593         toBeanMap(value).forEach((k,v) -> l.add(createPart(k, v, PATH, serializer, schema, false)));
1594      } else if (value != null) {
1595         throw new BasicRuntimeException("Invalid value type for path arg ''{0}'': {1}", name, className(value));
1596      }
1597
1598      pathData.append(l);
1599
1600      return this;
1601   }
1602
1603   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1604   // Request body
1605   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1606
1607   /**
1608    * Sets the body of this request.
1609    *
1610    * @param value
1611    *    The input to be sent to the REST resource (only valid for PUT/POST/PATCH) requests.
1612    *    <br>Can be of the following types:
1613    *    <ul class='spaced-list'>
1614    *       <li>
1615    *          {@link Reader} - Raw contents of {@code Reader} will be serialized to remote resource.
1616    *       <li>
1617    *          {@link InputStream} - Raw contents of {@code InputStream} will be serialized to remote resource.
1618    *       <li>
1619    *          {@link HttpResource} - Raw contents will be serialized to remote resource.  Additional headers and media type will be set on request.
1620    *       <li>
1621    *          {@link HttpEntity}/{@link BasicHttpEntity} - Bypass Juneau serialization and pass HttpEntity directly to HttpClient.
1622    *       <li>
1623    *          {@link Object} - POJO to be converted to text using the {@link Serializer} registered with the
1624    *          {@link RestClient}.
1625    *       <li>
1626    *          {@link PartList} - Converted to a URL-encoded FORM post.
1627    *       <li>
1628    *          A {@link Supplier} of anything on this list.
1629    *    </ul>
1630    * @return This object.
1631    */
1632   public RestRequest content(Object value) {
1633      this.content = value;
1634      return this;
1635   }
1636
1637   /**
1638    * Sets the body of this request as straight text bypassing the serializer.
1639    *
1640    * <p class='bjava'>
1641    *    <jv>client</jv>
1642    *       .put(<js>"/foo"</js>)
1643    *       .content(<jk>new</jk> StringReader(<js>"foo"</js>))
1644    *       .contentType(<js>"text/foo"</js>)
1645    *       .run();
1646    *
1647    * <jv>client</jv>
1648    *       .put(<js>"/foo"</js>)
1649    *       .bodyString(<js>"foo"</js>)
1650    *       .run();
1651    * </p>
1652    *
1653    * <p>
1654    * Note that this is different than the following which will serialize <l>foo</l> as a JSON string <l>"foo"</l>.
1655    * <p class='bjava'>
1656    *    <jv>client</jv>
1657    *       .put(<js>"/foo"</js>)
1658    *       .json()
1659    *       .content(<js>"foo"</js>)
1660    *       .run();
1661    * </p>
1662    *
1663    * @param input
1664    *    The input to be sent to the REST resource (only valid for PUT/POST/PATCH) requests.
1665    * @return This object.
1666    * @throws RestCallException If a retry was attempted, but the entity was not repeatable.
1667    */
1668   public RestRequest contentString(Object input) throws RestCallException {
1669      return content(input == null ? null : new StringReader(Utils.s(input)));
1670   }
1671
1672   /**
1673    * Sets the body of this request.
1674    *
1675    * @param input
1676    *    The input to be sent to the REST resource (only valid for PUT/POST/PATCH) requests.
1677    *    <br>Can be of the following types:
1678    *    <ul class='spaced-list'>
1679    *       <li>
1680    *          {@link Reader} - Raw contents of {@code Reader} will be serialized to remote resource.
1681    *       <li>
1682    *          {@link InputStream} - Raw contents of {@code InputStream} will be serialized to remote resource.
1683    *       <li>
1684    *          {@link HttpResource} - Raw contents will be serialized to remote resource.  Additional headers and media type will be set on request.
1685    *       <li>
1686    *          {@link HttpEntity}/{@link BasicHttpEntity} - Bypass Juneau serialization and pass HttpEntity directly to HttpClient.
1687    *       <li>
1688    *          {@link Object} - POJO to be converted to text using the {@link Serializer} registered with the
1689    *          {@link RestClient}.
1690    *       <li>
1691    *          {@link PartList} - Converted to a URL-encoded FORM post.
1692    *       <li>
1693    *          A {@link Supplier} of anything on this list.
1694    *    </ul>
1695    * @param schema The schema object that defines the format of the output.
1696    *    <ul>
1697    *       <li>If <jk>null</jk>, defaults to {@link HttpPartSchema#DEFAULT}.
1698    *       <li>Only used if serializer is schema-aware (e.g. {@link OpenApiSerializer}).
1699    *    </ul>
1700    * @return This object.
1701    */
1702   public RestRequest content(Object input, HttpPartSchema schema) {
1703      this.content = input;
1704      this.contentSchema = schema;
1705      return this;
1706   }
1707
1708   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1709   // Specialized headers.
1710   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1711
1712   /**
1713    * Sets the value for the <c>Accept</c> request header.
1714    *
1715    * <p>
1716    * This overrides the media type specified on the parser, but is overridden by calling
1717    * <code>header(<js>"Accept"</js>, value);</code>
1718    *
1719    * @param value The new header value.
1720    * @return This object.
1721    * @throws RestCallException Invalid input.
1722    */
1723   public RestRequest accept(String value) throws RestCallException {
1724      return header(Accept.of(value));
1725   }
1726
1727   /**
1728    * Sets the value for the <c>Accept-Charset</c> request header.
1729    *
1730    * <p>
1731    * This is a shortcut for calling <code>header(<js>"Accept-Charset"</js>, value);</code>
1732    *
1733    * @param value The new header value.
1734    * @return This object.
1735    * @throws RestCallException Invalid input.
1736    */
1737   public RestRequest acceptCharset(String value) throws RestCallException {
1738      return header(AcceptCharset.of(value));
1739   }
1740
1741   /**
1742    * Sets the value for the <c>Content-Type</c> request header.
1743    *
1744    * <p>
1745    * This overrides the media type specified on the serializer, but is overridden by calling
1746    * <code>header(<js>"Content-Type"</js>, value);</code>
1747    *
1748    * @param value The new header value.
1749    * @return This object.
1750    * @throws RestCallException Invalid input.
1751    */
1752   public RestRequest contentType(String value) throws RestCallException {
1753      return header(ContentType.of(value));
1754   }
1755
1756   /**
1757    * Shortcut for setting the <c>Accept</c> and <c>Content-Type</c> headers on a request.
1758    *
1759    * @param value The new header values.
1760    * @return This object.
1761    * @throws RestCallException Invalid input.
1762    */
1763   public RestRequest mediaType(String value) throws RestCallException {
1764      return header(Accept.of(value)).header(ContentType.of(value));
1765   }
1766
1767   /**
1768    * When called, <c>No-Trace: true</c> is added to requests.
1769    *
1770    * <p>
1771    * This gives the opportunity for the servlet to not log errors on invalid requests.
1772    * This is useful for testing purposes when you don't want your log file to show lots of errors that are simply the
1773    * results of testing.
1774    *
1775    * @return This object.
1776    * @throws RestCallException Invalid input.
1777    */
1778   public RestRequest noTrace() throws RestCallException {
1779      return header(NoTrace.TRUE);
1780   }
1781
1782   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1783   // Execution methods.
1784   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1785
1786   /**
1787    * Runs this request and returns the resulting response object.
1788    *
1789    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1790    * <p class='bjava'>
1791    *    <jk>try</jk> {
1792    *       <jk>int</jk> <jv>rc</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).execute().getResponseStatus();
1793    *       <jc>// Succeeded!</jc>
1794    *    } <jk>catch</jk> (RestCallException <jv>e</jv>) {
1795    *       <jc>// Failed!</jc>
1796    *    }
1797    * </p>
1798    *
1799    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
1800    *    <li class='note'>Calling this method multiple times will return the same original response object.
1801    *    <li class='note'>You must close the returned object if you do not consume the response or execute a method that consumes
1802    *       the response.
1803    *    <li class='note'>If you are only interested in the response code, use the {@link #complete()} method which will automatically
1804    *       consume the response so that you don't need to call {@link InputStream#close()} on the response body.
1805    * </ul>
1806    *
1807    * @return The response object.
1808    * @throws RestCallException If an exception or non-200 response code occurred during the connection attempt.
1809    */
1810   public RestResponse run() throws RestCallException {
1811      if (response != null)
1812         throw new RestCallException(response, null, "run() already called.");
1813
1814      try {
1815
1816         queryData.stream().map(SimpleQuery::new).filter(SimplePart::isValid).forEach(
1817            x -> uriBuilder.addParameter(x.name, x.value)
1818         );
1819
1820         pathData.stream().map(SimplePath::new).forEach(x ->
1821            {
1822               String path = uriBuilder.getPath();
1823               String name = x.name, value = x.value;
1824               String var = "{" + name + "}";
1825               if (path.indexOf(var) == -1 && ! name.equals("/*"))
1826                  throw new IllegalStateException("Path variable {" + name + "} was not found in path.");
1827               if (name.equals("/*"))
1828                  path = path.replaceAll("\\/\\*$", "/" + value);
1829               else
1830                  path = path.replace(var, String.valueOf(value));
1831               uriBuilder.setPath(path);
1832            }
1833         );
1834
1835         HttpEntityEnclosingRequestBase request2 = request instanceof HttpEntityEnclosingRequestBase ? (HttpEntityEnclosingRequestBase)request : null;
1836         request.setURI(uriBuilder.build());
1837
1838         // Pick the serializer if it hasn't been overridden.
1839         HeaderList hl = headerData;
1840         Optional<Header> h = hl.getLast("Content-Type");
1841         String contentType = h.isPresent() ? h.get().getValue() : null;
1842         Serializer serializer = this.serializer;
1843         if (serializer == null)
1844            serializer = client.getMatchingSerializer(contentType);
1845         if (contentType == null && serializer != null)
1846            contentType = serializer.getPrimaryMediaType().toString();
1847
1848         // Pick the parser if it hasn't been overridden.
1849         h = hl.getLast("Accept");
1850         String accept = h.isPresent() ? h.get().getValue() : null;
1851         Parser parser = this.parser;
1852         if (parser == null)
1853            parser = client.getMatchingParser(accept);
1854         if (accept == null && parser != null)
1855            hl.set(Accept.of( parser.getPrimaryMediaType()));
1856
1857         headerData.stream().map(SimpleHeader::new).filter(SimplePart::isValid).forEach(x -> request.addHeader(x));
1858
1859         if (request2 == null && content != NO_BODY)
1860            throw new RestCallException(null, null, "Method does not support content entity.  Method={0}, URI={1}", getMethod(), getURI());
1861
1862         if (request2 != null) {
1863
1864            Object input2 = null;
1865            if (content != NO_BODY) {
1866               input2 = content;
1867            } else {
1868               input2 = new UrlEncodedFormEntity(formData.stream().map(SimpleFormData::new).filter(SimplePart::isValid).collect(toList()));
1869            }
1870
1871            if (input2 instanceof Supplier)
1872               input2 = ((Supplier<?>)input2).get();
1873
1874            HttpEntity entity = null;
1875            if (input2 instanceof PartList)
1876               entity = new UrlEncodedFormEntity(((PartList)input2).stream().map(SimpleFormData::new).filter(SimplePart::isValid).collect(toList()));
1877            else if (input2 instanceof HttpResource) {
1878               HttpResource r = (HttpResource)input2;
1879               r.getHeaders().forEach(x -> request.addHeader(x));
1880               entity = (HttpEntity)input2;
1881            }
1882            else if (input2 instanceof HttpEntity) {
1883               if (input2 instanceof SerializedEntity) {
1884                  entity = ((SerializedEntity)input2).copyWith(serializer, contentSchema);
1885               } else {
1886                  entity = (HttpEntity)input2;
1887               }
1888            }
1889            else if (input2 instanceof Reader)
1890               entity = readerEntity((Reader)input2, getRequestContentType(TEXT_PLAIN));
1891            else if (input2 instanceof InputStream)
1892               entity = streamEntity((InputStream)input2, -1, getRequestContentType(ContentType.APPLICATION_OCTET_STREAM));
1893            else if (serializer != null)
1894               entity = serializedEntity(input2, serializer, contentSchema).setContentType(contentType);
1895            else {
1896               if (client.hasSerializers()) {
1897                  if (contentType == null)
1898                     throw new RestCallException(null, null, "Content-Type not specified on request.  Cannot match correct serializer.  Use contentType(String) or mediaType(String) to specify transport language.");
1899                  throw new RestCallException(null, null, "No matching serializer for media type ''{0}''", contentType);
1900               }
1901               entity = stringEntity(input2 == null ? "" : BeanContext.DEFAULT.getClassMetaForObject(input2).toString(input2), getRequestContentType(TEXT_PLAIN));
1902            }
1903
1904            request2.setEntity(entity);
1905         }
1906
1907         try {
1908            response = client.createResponse(this, client.run(target, request, context), parser);
1909         } catch (Exception e) {
1910            throw e;
1911         }
1912
1913         if (isDebug() || client.logRequests == DetailLevel.FULL)
1914            response.cacheContent();
1915
1916         for (RestCallInterceptor rci : interceptors)
1917            rci.onConnect(this, response);
1918         client.onCallConnect(this, response);
1919
1920         String method = getMethod();
1921         int sc = response.getStatusCode();
1922
1923         Thrown thrown = response.getHeader("Thrown").asHeader(Thrown.class);
1924         if (thrown.isPresent() && rethrow != null) {
1925            Thrown.Part thrownPart = thrown.asParts().get().get(0);
1926            String className = thrownPart.getClassName();
1927            String message = thrownPart.getMessage();
1928            for (Class<? extends Throwable> t : rethrow) {
1929               if (t.getName().equals(className)) {
1930                  ConstructorInfo c = null;
1931                  ClassInfo ci = ClassInfo.of(t);
1932                  c = ci.getPublicConstructor(x -> x.hasParamTypes(HttpResponse.class));
1933                  if (c != null)
1934                     throw c.<Throwable>invoke(response);
1935                  c = ci.getPublicConstructor(x -> x.hasParamTypes(String.class));
1936                  if (c != null)
1937                     throw c.<Throwable>invoke(message != null ? message : response.getContent().asString());
1938                  c = ci.getPublicConstructor(x -> x.hasParamTypes(String.class,Throwable.class));
1939                  if (c != null)
1940                     throw c.<Throwable>invoke(message != null ? message : response.getContent().asString(), null);
1941                  c = ci.getPublicConstructor(ConstructorInfo::hasNoParams);
1942                  if (c != null)
1943                     throw c.<Throwable>invoke();
1944               }
1945            }
1946         }
1947
1948         if (errorCodes.test(sc) && ! ignoreErrors) {
1949            throw new RestCallException(response, null, "HTTP method ''{0}'' call to ''{1}'' caused response code ''{2}, {3}''.\nResponse: \n{4}",
1950               method, getURI(), sc, response.getReasonPhrase(), response.getContent().asAbbreviatedString(1000));
1951         }
1952
1953      } catch (RuntimeException | RestCallException e) {
1954         if (response != null)
1955            response.close();
1956         throw e;
1957      } catch (Throwable e) {
1958         if (response != null)
1959            response.close();
1960         throw new RestCallException(response, e, "Call failed.");
1961      }
1962
1963      return this.response;
1964   }
1965
1966   /**
1967    * Same as {@link #run()} but allows you to run the call asynchronously.
1968    *
1969    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1970    * <p class='bjava'>
1971    *    Future&lt;RestResponse&gt; <jv>future</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).runFuture();
1972    *
1973    *    <jc>// Do some other stuff</jc>
1974    *
1975    *    <jk>try</jk> {
1976    *       String <jv>body</jv> = <jv>future</jv>.get().getContent().asString();
1977    *       <jc>// Succeeded!</jc>
1978    *    } <jk>catch</jk> (RestCallException <jv>e</jv>) {
1979    *       <jc>// Failed!</jc>
1980    *    }
1981    * </p>
1982    *
1983    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
1984    *    <li class='note'>Use the {@link RestClient.Builder#executorService(ExecutorService, boolean)} method to customize the
1985    *       executor service used for creating {@link Future Futures}.
1986    * </ul>
1987    *
1988    * @return The HTTP status code.
1989    * @throws RestCallException If the executor service was not defined.
1990    */
1991    public Future<RestResponse> runFuture() throws RestCallException {
1992        return client.getExecutorService().submit(this::run);
1993    }
1994
1995   /**
1996    * Same as {@link #run()} but immediately calls {@link RestResponse#consume()} to clean up the response.
1997    *
1998    * <p>
1999    * Use this method if you're only interested in the status line of the response and not the response entity.
2000    * Attempts to call any of the methods on the response object that retrieve the body (e.g. {@link ResponseContent#asReader()}
2001    * will cause a {@link RestCallException} to be thrown.
2002    *
2003    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
2004    *    <li class='note'>You do not need to execute {@link InputStream#close()} on the response body to consume the response.
2005    * </ul>
2006    *
2007    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
2008    * <p class='bjava'>
2009    *  <jc>// Get the response code.
2010    *  // No need to call close() on the RestResponse object.</jc>
2011    *  <jk>int</jk> <jv>rc</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).complete().getResponseCode();
2012    * </p>
2013    *
2014    * @return The response object.
2015    * @throws RestCallException If an exception or non-200 response code occurred during the connection attempt.
2016    */
2017   public RestResponse complete() throws RestCallException {
2018      return run().consume();
2019   }
2020
2021   /**
2022    * Same as {@link #complete()} but allows you to run the call asynchronously.
2023    *
2024    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
2025    * <p class='bjava'>
2026    *    Future&lt;RestResponse&gt; <jv>future</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.get(<jsf>URI</jsf>).completeFuture();
2027    *
2028    *    <jc>// Do some other stuff</jc>
2029    *
2030    *    <jk>int</jk> <jv>rc</jv> = <jv>future</jv>.get().getResponseStatus();
2031    * </p>
2032    *
2033    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
2034    *    <li class='note'>Use the {@link RestClient.Builder#executorService(ExecutorService, boolean)} method to customize the
2035    *       executor service used for creating {@link Future Futures}.
2036    *    <li class='note'>You do not need to execute {@link InputStream#close()} on the response body to consume the response.
2037    * </ul>
2038    *
2039    * @return The HTTP status code.
2040    * @throws RestCallException If the executor service was not defined.
2041    */
2042   public Future<RestResponse> completeFuture() throws RestCallException {
2043      return client.getExecutorService().submit(
2044         this::complete
2045      );
2046   }
2047
2048   /**
2049    * A shortcut for calling <c>run().getContent().asString()</c>.
2050    *
2051    * @return The response content as a simple string.
2052    * @throws RestCallException If an exception or non-200 response code occurred during the connection attempt.
2053    */
2054   public String getResponseAsString() throws RestCallException {
2055      return run().getContent().asString();
2056   }
2057
2058   /**
2059    * A shortcut for calling <c>run().getContent().as(<js>type</js>)</c>.
2060    *
2061    * @param type The object type to create.
2062    * @param <T> The object type to create.
2063    * @see ResponseContent#as(Class)
2064    * @return The response content as a simple string.
2065    * @throws RestCallException If an exception or non-200 response code occurred during the connection attempt.
2066    */
2067   public <T> T getResponse(Class<T> type) throws RestCallException {
2068      return run().getContent().as(type);
2069   }
2070
2071   /**
2072    * A shortcut for calling <c>run().getContent().as(<js>type</js>,<js>args</js>)</c>.
2073    *
2074    * @param <T>
2075    *    The object type to create.
2076    * @param type
2077    *    The object type to create.
2078    *    <br>Can be any of the following: {@link ClassMeta}, {@link Class}, {@link ParameterizedType}, {@link GenericArrayType}
2079    * @param args
2080    *    The type arguments of the class if it's a collection or map.
2081    *    <br>Can be any of the following: {@link ClassMeta}, {@link Class}, {@link ParameterizedType}, {@link GenericArrayType}
2082    *    <br>Ignored if the main type is not a map or collection.
2083    * @see ResponseContent#as(Type,Type...)
2084    * @return The response content as a simple string.
2085    * @throws RestCallException If an exception or non-200 response code occurred during the connection attempt.
2086    */
2087   public <T> T getResponse(Type type, Type...args) throws RestCallException {
2088      return run().getContent().as(type, args);
2089   }

2097      return request instanceof HttpEntityEnclosingRequestBase;

2105   public HttpEntity getHttpEntity() {
2106      return hasHttpEntity() ? ((HttpEntityEnclosingRequestBase)request).getEntity() : null;
2107   }

2203    * </ul>
2204    *

2213    * Aborts this http request. Any active execution of this method should return immediately.
2214    *
2215    * If the request has not started, it will abort after the next execution.
2216    * <br>Aborting this request will cause all subsequent executions with this request to fail.
2217    */
2218   @Override /* HttpUriRequest */
2219   public void abort() throws UnsupportedOperationException {
2220      request.abort();
2221   }

2248   /**

2254    * @return <jk>true</jk> if at least one header with this name is present.
2255    */
2256   @Override /* HttpMessage */
2257   public boolean containsHeader(String name) {
2258      return headerData.contains(name);
2259   }

2261   /**
2262    * Returns all the headers with a specified name of this message.
2263    *
2264    * Header values are ignored.
2265    * <br>Headers are ordered in the sequence they will be sent over a connection.
2266    *
2267    * @param name The name of the headers to return.
2268    * @return The headers whose name property equals name.
2269    */
2270   @Override /* HttpMessage */
2271   public Header[] getHeaders(String name) {
2272      return headerData.getAll(name);
2273   }

2275   /**
2276    * Returns the first header with a specified name of this message.
2277    *
2278    * Header values are ignored.
2279    * <br>If there is more than one matching header in the message the first element of {@link #getHeaders(String)} is returned.
2280    * <br>If there is no matching header in the message <jk>null</jk> is returned.
2281    *
2282    * @param name The name of the header to return.
2283    * @return The first header whose name property equals name or <jk>null</jk> if no such header could be found.
2284    */
2285   @Override /* HttpMessage */
2286   public Header getFirstHeader(String name) {
2287      return headerData.getFirst(name).orElse(null);
2288   }
2289
2290   /**
2291    * Returns the last header with a specified name of this message.
2292    *
2293    * Header values are ignored.
2294    * <br>If there is more than one matching header in the message the last element of {@link #getHeaders(String)} is returned.
2295    * <br>If there is no matching header in the message null is returned.
2296    *
2297    * @param name The name of the header to return.
2298    * @return The last header whose name property equals name or <jk>null</jk> if no such header could be found.
2299    */
2300   @Override /* HttpMessage */
2301   public Header getLastHeader(String name) {
2302      return headerData.getLast(name).orElse(null);
2303   }
2304
2305   /**
2306    * Returns all the headers of this message.
2307    *
2308    * Headers are ordered in the sequence they will be sent over a connection.
2309    *
2310    * @return All the headers of this message
2311    */
2312   @Override /* HttpMessage */
2313   public Header[] getAllHeaders() {
2314      return headerData.getAll();
2315   }

2317   /**
2318    * Adds a header to this message.
2319    *
2320    * The header will be appended to the end of the list.
2321    *

2323    *    <li class='note'>{@link #header(Header)} is an equivalent method and the preferred method for fluent-style coding.
2324    * </ul>
2325    *
2326    * @param header The header to append.
2327    */
2328   @Override /* HttpMessage */
2329   public void addHeader(Header header) {
2330      headerData.append(header);
2331   }

2336    * The header will be appended to the end of the list.
2337    *

2343    * @param value The value of the header.

2345   @Override /* HttpMessage */

2460   // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2461   // Utility methods
2462   // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2463
2464   private ContentType getRequestContentType(ContentType def) {
2465      Header h = request.getFirstHeader("Content-Type");
2466      if (h != null) {
2467         String s = h.getValue();
2468         if (! isEmpty(s))
2469            return ContentType.of(s);
2470      }
2471      return def;
2472   }
2473
2474   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
2475   private static Map<Object,Object> toMap(Object o) {
2476      return (Map<Object,Object>)o;
2477   }
2478
2479   /**
2480    * Creates a new header.
2481    *
2482    * @param name The header name.
2483    * @param value The header value.
2484    * @param serializer The part serializer to use, or <jk>null</jk> to use the part serializer defined on the client.
2485    * @param schema Optional HTTP part schema to provide to the part serializer.
2486    * @param skipIfEmpty If <jk>true</jk>, empty string values will be ignored on the request.
2487    * @return A new header.
2488    */
2489   protected Header createHeader(String name, Object value, HttpPartSerializer serializer, HttpPartSchema schema, Boolean skipIfEmpty) {
2490      if (isEmpty(name))
2491         return null;
2492      if (skipIfEmpty == null)
2493         skipIfEmpty = client.isSkipEmptyHeaderData();
2494      if (serializer == null)
2495         serializer = client.getPartSerializer();
2496      return new SerializedHeader(name, value, getPartSerializerSession(serializer), schema, skipIfEmpty);
2497   }
2498
2499   private Header createHeader(String name, Object value) {
2500      return createHeader(name, value, null, null, null);
2501   }
2502
2503   /**
2504    * Creates a new query/form-data/path part.
2505    *
2506    * @param name The part name.
2507    * @param value The part value.
2508    * @param type The HTTP part type.
2509    * @param serializer The part serializer to use, or <jk>null</jk> to use the part serializer defined on the client.
2510    * @param schema Optional HTTP part schema to provide to the part serializer.
2511    * @param skipIfEmpty If <jk>true</jk>, empty string values will be ignored on the request.
2512    * @return A new part.
2513    */
2514   protected NameValuePair createPart(String name, Object value, HttpPartType type, HttpPartSerializer serializer, HttpPartSchema schema, Boolean skipIfEmpty) {
2515      if (isEmpty(name))
2516         return null;
2517      if (skipIfEmpty == null) {
2518         if (type == QUERY)
2519            skipIfEmpty = client.isSkipEmptyQueryData();
2520         else if (type == FORMDATA)
2521            skipIfEmpty = client.isSkipEmptyFormData();
2522         else
2523            skipIfEmpty = false;
2524      }
2525      if (serializer == null)
2526         serializer = client.getPartSerializer();
2527      return new SerializedPart(name, value, type, getPartSerializerSession(serializer), schema, skipIfEmpty);
2528   }
2529
2530   private NameValuePair createPart(HttpPartType type, String name, Object value) {
2531      return createPart(name, value, type, null, null, null);
2532   }
2533
2534   private HttpPartSerializerSession getPartSerializerSession(HttpPartSerializer serializer) {
2535      if (serializer == null)
2536         serializer = client.getPartSerializer();
2537      HttpPartSerializerSession s = partSerializerSessions.get(serializer);
2538      if (s == null) {
2539         s = serializer.getPartSession();
2540         partSerializerSessions.put(serializer, s);
2541      }
2542      return s;
2543   }
2544
2545   HttpPartSerializerSession getPartSerializerSession() {
2546      if (partSerializerSession == null)
2547         partSerializerSession = getPartSerializerSession(null);
2548      return partSerializerSession;
2549   }
2550
2551   private static boolean isNameValuePairArray(Object o) {
2552      if (! isArray(o))
2553         return false;
2554      if (NameValuePair.class.isAssignableFrom(o.getClass().getComponentType()))
2555         return true;
2556      return false;
2557   }
2558
2559   private static boolean isHeaderArray(Object o) {
2560      if (! isArray(o))
2561         return false;
2562      if (Header.class.isAssignableFrom(o.getClass().getComponentType()))
2563         return true;
2564      return false;
2565   }
2566
2567   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2568   // Simple parts
2569   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2570
2571   private class SimplePart implements NameValuePair {
2572      final String name;
2573      final String value;
2574
2575      SimplePart(NameValuePair x, boolean skipIfEmpty) {
2576         name = x.getName();
2577         if (x instanceof SerializedHeader) {
2578            value = ((SerializedHeader)x).copyWith(getPartSerializerSession(), null).getValue();
2579         } else if (x instanceof SerializedPart) {
2580            value = ((SerializedPart)x).copyWith(getPartSerializerSession(), null).getValue();
2581         } else {
2582            String v = x.getValue();
2583            value = (isEmpty(v) && skipIfEmpty) ? null : v;
2584         }
2585      }
2586
2587      boolean isValid() {
2588         if (isEmpty(name) || value == null)
2589            return false;
2590         return true;
2591      }
2592
2593      @Override
2594      public String getName() {
2595         return name;
2596      }
2597
2598      @Override
2599      public String getValue() {
2600         return value;
2601      }
2602   }
2603
2604   private class SimpleQuery extends SimplePart {
2605      SimpleQuery(NameValuePair x) {
2606         super(x, client.isSkipEmptyQueryData());
2607      }
2608   }
2609
2610   private class SimpleFormData extends SimplePart {
2611      SimpleFormData(NameValuePair x) {
2612         super(x, client.isSkipEmptyFormData());
2613      }
2614   }
2615
2616   private class SimplePath extends SimplePart {
2617      SimplePath(NameValuePair x) {
2618         super(x, false);
2619      }
2620   }
2621
2622   private class SimpleHeader extends SimplePart implements Header {
2623
2624      SimpleHeader(NameValuePair x) {
2625         super(x, client.isSkipEmptyHeaderData());
2626      }
2627
2628      @Override
2629      public HeaderElement[] getElements() throws ParseException {
2630         return null;
2631      }
2632   }
2633
2634   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2635   // Fluent setters
2636   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2637   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2638   // Other methods
2639   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2640
2641   /**
2642    * Closes this request and its associated response (if one was created).
2643    *
2644    * <p>
2645    * This method is idempotent and can be called multiple times without side effects.
2646    *
2647    * <h5 class='section'>Implementation Notes:</h5>
2648    * <p>
2649    * This implementation represents a compromise between strict AutoCloseable compliance and debuggability:
2650    * <ul>
2651    *    <li>Unchecked exceptions ({@link RuntimeException} and {@link Error}) from the response close are allowed to propagate.
2652    *       This ensures programming errors and serious issues are visible during development and testing.
2653    *    <li>Checked exceptions (including {@link RestCallException}) are caught and logged but not thrown.
2654    *       This follows AutoCloseable best practices and prevents close exceptions from interfering with
2655    *       try-with-resources cleanup or masking the original exception.
2656    * </ul>
2657    */
2658   @Override /* AutoCloseable */
2659   public void close() {
2660      try {
2661         if (response != null) {
2662            response.close();
2663         }
2664      } catch (RuntimeException | Error e) {
2665         // Let unchecked exceptions propagate for debuggability
2666         throw e;
2667      } catch (Exception e) {
2668         // Log checked exceptions but don't throw - follows AutoCloseable best practices
2669         client.log(Level.WARNING, e, "Error closing RestResponse");
2670      }
2671   }
2672
2673   @Override /* ContextSession */
2674   protected JsonMap properties() {
2675      return filteredMap()
2676         .append("client", client.properties())
2677         .append("ignoreErrors", ignoreErrors)
2678         .append("interceptors", interceptors)
2679         .append("requestBodySchema", contentSchema)
2680         .append("response", response)
2681         .append("serializer", serializer);
2682   }
2683}
